devanagari:
अहं आत्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः।
अहं आदिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च॥ ४ ॥
transliteration:
ahaṁ ātmā guḍākeśa sarva-būtāśaya-sthitaḥ
ahaṁ ādiś ca madhyaṁ ca bhūtānām anta eva ca

synonyms.meaning: O Arjuna (the one with thick hair)

translation: I am the Self, O Gudakesha, seated in the hearts of all creatures. I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.
purport: In this verse, Lord Krishna reveals His omnipresence as the Supreme Soul residing in the hearts of all living entities. This emphasizes the intimate connection between the Supreme Lord and all beings. Krishna identifies Himself as the beginning, middle, and end of all creation, indicating that everything emanates from Him, exists within Him, and ultimately returns to Him. This understanding fosters a sense of unity and interconnectedness among all living beings, highlighting the divine presence in every aspect of life. Recognizing Krishna as the Supreme Self encourages devotees to cultivate a deeper relationship with Him, leading to spiritual growth and liberation from material bondage.
